induce.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to persuade someone to do something, especially something that does not seem wise
induce.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Nothing would induce me to vote for him again.
induce.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to make a woman give birth to her baby, by giving her a special drug
induce.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: She had to be induced because the baby was four weeks late.
The doctor decided to induce labour.
induce.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to cause a particular physical condition
induce.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: Patients with eating disorders may use drugs to induce vomiting.
induce.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to make someone decide to do something, perhaps something that seems unwise
induce.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Lower interest rates would induce customers to borrow more.
